.definition: to have trust in the goodness or ability of (someone)
.example: I do not believe in formulas.I believe in integrity.

.definition: up to now
.example: No suspect has been found to date

.definition: to start the flow of electricity, gas, water, etc. by moving a switch, button, etc.
.example: She turned on the TV

.definition: near, next to
.example: I walked up to the window and paused.

.definition: to be involved in something
.example: It’s something we all wanted to take part in.

.definition: to anticipate, to be eager for something to happen
.example: It would be a pleasure to face off with you sometime, somewhere. I look forward to this.

.definition: to change or develop from one thing to another
.example: Rain in the morning will turn into snow during the afternoon.

.definition: certain or likely to happen, or to do or be something
.example: It will be bound to have an effect on the election when it happens.

.definition: be aware of or know of the existence of someone or something.
.example: Haven’t you ever heard of manners?

.definition: used to talk about the present, especially when you are comparing it with the past
.example: It’s what these days the media call ‘viral’.

.definition: a short time
.example: There are many short term gains to be had.

.definition: to feel one would like
.example: I feel like staying in bed all day

.definition: try to find out more about something; do something else to achieve aim
.example: I’d like to follow up on what that gentleman said.

.definition: to remove or throw away something unwanted
.example: I can’t wait to get rid of that ugly old couch

.definition: to wait for a short time
.example: Please hang on while I get your folder

.definition: the most important
.example: above all, you must be independent

.definition: anyway, whatever happens or may have happened
.example: She couldn't shelter behind him all the time and in any case he wasn't always with her

.definition: as given below
.example: The plan is as follows.

.definition: about
.example: It’s more or less what we imagined I suppose.

.definition: to cause to happen, occur, or exist
.example: The new policies are expected to bring about significant changes in the education system.

.definition: start doing something new or making progress
.example: I've been in this job long enough—it's time to move on.

.definition: to continue; to proceed without hesitation
.example: We have more than enough food for dinner. Go ahead and invite your friend to join us.

.definition: having responsibility for
.example: John is in charge of all international sales for his company.

.definition: something that is above or previously mentioned
.example: The above only underscores strength of the data.

.definition: to discuss, examine, describe, or explain something in a detailed or careful way
.example: This is the first book to go into her personal life as well as her work.

.definition: a great many, a lot
.example: You don’t see too many like that one, I’ll tell you.

.definition: during the specified period or activity
.example: He was a friend to many people in the course of his life

.definition: if a plan or idea is aimed at a particular thing, it has the goal of achieving that thing
.example: The regulations are aimed at the prevention of accidents at work.

.definition: to leave a place and go somewhere else
.example: They began to go off each other after two months together.

.definition: in order to be prepared for something that may happen
.example: Take an umbrella in case it rains.

.definition: in a place that could be anywhere except here
.example: There are simply no jobs out there right now.

.definition: being caused, motivated by something or someone
.example: He was led by his competitive drive above all.

.definition: to indicate that something is becoming greater in amount, extent, or degree all the time
.example: Her life was heading more and more where she wanted it to go.

.definition: to look at with attention, to observe
.example: Why don’t you have a look?

.definition: to express something in words
.example: She wanted to tell him that she didn't want to see him any more, but she didn't know how to put it.

.definition: to the degree or extent that
.example: She had done her best to comfort him, insofar as she was able.

.definition: using the exact meaning of the word or phrase
.example: The film was not a horror as such.

.definition: likely to do something
.example: He’s set to arrive today.

.definition: used when second thing very different from first
.example: The inside was amazing in contrast.

.definition: at the current point in some event or situation; currently
.example: We'll have to wait and see. There isn't much we can do at this stage.

.definition: almost completely
.example: In some places, bus service has all but disappeared.

.definition: because of someone or something
.example: And it’s thanks to her research that we know that.

.definition: to disappear
.example: The problem won’t just go away.

.definition: another time
.example: I’ll explain it once more, but listen this time.

.definition: used for accepting bad situation or disappointment.
.example: "I can't go out for cocktails Friday night." "Oh well."

.definition: used for giving your opinion even though other people may not agree
.example: I don’t know, but I would say at least twenty.

.definition: having been discovered by chance or unexpectedly.
.example: It was found to be of little use in battle.

.definition: intended to (do or be something)
.example: I haven’t seen it but it’s meant to be his best so far.

.definition: used to say that a person, situation etc has a quality or feature that you recognize but you cannot say exactly what it is
.example: There’s something about her voice that I find really sexy.

.definition: At some time in the near past.
.example: My parents should have arrived by now. I wonder what's keeping them.

.definition: used to say that you agree with the fact that has just been stated earlier.
.example: "Do you think he's upset?" "I don't think so."
